snippet: Beneath the signs of recovery is one of the most poorly funded pension systems in the nation, threatening to challenge the city’s finances for years to come.
abstract: Chicago is wrestling with overwhelming pension liabilities that threaten to undermine its capacity to provide municipal services and secure its future; it has one of the most poorly funded pension systems for retired city workers among the nation’s major cities; experts say Chicago’s troubles were years in the making; plight is result of city contributions under a state-authorized formula that failed to accumulate nearly enough money, two economic downturns in the 2000s and impasse in the State Capitol.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH
byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Chicago, and Mary Williams Walsh from New York.

lead_paragraph: Beneath the signs of recovery is one of the most poorly funded pension systems in the nation, threatening to challenge the city’s finances for years to come.

headline.main: Chicago Sees Pension Crisis Drawing Near
headline.print_headline: Chicago Sees Pension Crisis Drawing Near
